data.title: GCN Sites2.cfg File
data.text:
This shows the contents and format of the currently used "sites2.cfg" file, which contains the configuration details for each site. This page is updated automatically every UT midnight (sometimes more often via manual activities). There is a long header of comments at the beginning of the file that explains the contents, columns, and legal values; then comes the actual table of sites entries.

# sites2.cfg -- contains all the information for the world customers (and intra-gcn operations) # # USAGE: # This one file is used by BOTH the gromain program AND the 9 votan programs. # (The master file is kept on the capella2 machine. # Any edits are automatically/immediately scp'd to the webpage machine. # However, there is no automatic scp-ing to the 9 votan machines -- that has to be done manually.) # # CONTENT: # There are 7 sections (ie categories) of entries: # 1) Operations Input/Output feeds of information between the various pieces of GCN/TAN (ie the *_receiver & votan programs). # 2) Votan-socket GCN customers that use the VOEvent (true server/broker socket) distribution method. # 3) Gromain-socket GCN customers that use the 2 original gromain socket-based methods of distribution. # 4) Email-based GCN customers that use the 7 different email-based methods of distribution. # 5) Non-Active Sites, temporarily "commented out" from the active list. # 6) Admin Administrative entries (me, Teresa) plus the *_TST (loop-back entries) plus the . # 7) Testing Entries for me to test new functionality, monitor speed, etc. # # ORDER: # The order does not really matter. There are very minor speed improvements (~30 msec) to having all the socket-based entries up front. # There has been some attempt at ordering within the email-based entries. (It takes about 200 msec to make the email script and # ~2 min to launch 300 emails, but this is still small compared to the human-response time to those received emails.) # # MODS: # ?????11 Converted the "plain" sites.cfg to this (new format) sites2.cfg file; running both in parallel/cross-checking. # 28mar11 Switched to using this file (the "2" file) as the one making the control decisions. # 27aug11 Transferred daily_report status from the do_all_sock_reports script to the appropriate DAILY_REPORT_ENABLE field. # 10nov11 Added VOTANa_FEED entry to start testing the VO_Event Atlantic Server/Broker portion of TAN/GCN. # 19dec11 Included the (previously hardwired) VOevent entries so that votan can directly use this sites2.cfg file. # 29jan12 Added VOTANl_FEED entry to start testing the VO_Event Linode Server/Broker portion of TAN/GCN. # 29jan12 Added VOTANe_FEED entry to start testing the VO_Event eApps Server/Broker portion of TAN/GCN. # 30jan12 Changed site with the name VOEVENT_FEED to VOEVENT_SOURCE. # 01mar12 Converted all VOEVENT/S_XML/E_XML to VOEVENT11/S_XML11/E_XML11 (in prep for the coming *20 methods). # 23feb14 Added the VOTANalvc_FEED for the LVC-version of votan server[/broker] portion of TAN/GCN. # 21nov14 Added PAE9_CP_TST entry (so Phil can do better full-loop testing, for Swift XRT auto-processing). # 08dec14 Added LVC_ALERT to my 2or3 entries & to the ~3 LVC-testing-related entries. # 05jan15 Finaly deleted the non-active KONUS2 entry in section 2. We have not used it in years and # it was in the wrong place anyway. # 04feb15 Changed LVC_ALERT to LVC_PRELIMINARY (to match LVC's new naming convention for this Notice type). # 29feb15 Added the VOTANelvc_FEED for the LVC-version of votan server[/broker] portion of TAN/GCN. # 04mar15 Added Singer_Test. # 08apr15 Added LVC FEED for the Linode. # 17apr15 Added AMON_OPS entry (for the amon_receiver program). # 20jun15 Got rid of trailing whitespace on about 50 Token-lines. # 21jun15 CO-ed the 24 SBspeed and 24 kazoospeed entries. # 30jun15 Finally moved the VOEVENT{11,20} entries to section "2)" of this file. # 30jul15 Added VOTANalvc1_FEED. A ver1.1 feed to a proprietary_phase LVC server. # 12aug15 Added the CALET_TST (loop-back) entry. # 01sep15 Restructured the 4 Pi-of-the-Sky entries. # 17nov15 Added VOTANa3_FEED. # 13mar16 Started adding CALET_* types to entries. # 08mar16 Started adding AMON_ICECUBE_HESE types to entries. # 07Jul16 Started adding AMON_ICECUBE_EHE types to entries. # 01aug16 Added explicit more 0's to the inten=-1.0 fields to keep the diff-inator happier. Ditto COUNTERPART, =99.0. # 10aug16 Added explicit sim_ned=0 fields to the appropriate Swift/INTEGRAL types to keep the diff-inator happier. # 25nov17 Changed all the scott@milkyway's to sbarthel@milkyway's as a result of all the problems # that resulted from DPF's adding SPS-From-line "fix". # 14dec18 Reinstated/converted the LVC notice types & subtypes specifications from the O2 format to the ER13 format for ~205 sites. # 23dec18 Commented-out the LVC_TEST types from the ~205 sites that had LVC_TEST enabled. # LVC does not want the GCN-generated TEST notice to be distributed any more. # 11may19 AGILE_MCAL announced public and sites get enabled for that type. # 14jun19 HAWC_BURST, ICECUBE_ASTROTRACK_GOLD & _BRONZE announced public and sites get enabled for those 3 types. # # DO THIS ONLY AFTER SENT EMAILS to all the previous recipients letting them know they like should sign up for the GOLD/BRONZE types!!!! # 13aug19 Physically deleted all the AMON_ICECUBE_HESE_EVENT & AMON_ICECUBE_EHE_EVENT, since they have been CO's since 25jul9. # 14dec19 Add VOTANa4_COMET_FEED. # 15jan19 Removed VOTANa4_COMET_FEED. # # 01jun20 The big change: add all the AMON_NU_EM_COINC & LVC_EARLY_WARNING. # # 13jan22 Add the GCN-connection Kafka (160byte socket for temporary connection). KAFKA_160_CONNECTION # 14feb22 Add the GCN Kafka (the distribution method VO_FEED20: 160byte socket plus voevent). KAFKA_FEED Very special. # Event though it looks like a regular costomer; it is really a VO_FEED20. # # NNjun20 Add ICECUBE_CASCADE to SBLmailAll & SHEETS accounts. # 01sep22 Add GECAM_FLT, GECAM_GND to SBLmailAll & SHEETS accounts. ############## 1) The Inter-GCN Process Comm Links (*_OPS & *_FEED & VOEVENT_SOURCE): ##################################### # It contains: INTEGRAL_OPS, SWIFT_OPS, GLAST_OPS, LVC_OPS # LVC_BENTPIPE_FEED, LVC_1440_FEED, AMON_OPS, [IMPORT_OPS] # VOTANa_FEED, VOTANalvc_FEED, VOTANalvc1_FEED, VOTANa3_FEED, VOTANa4_FEED, VOTANa4_COMET_FEED # VOTANa4_COMET_FEED, VOTANl_FEED, VOTANllvc_FEED, # VOTANllvc1_FEED, VOTANe_FEED, VOTANelvc_FEED, VOTANelvc1_FEED, VOEVENT_SOURCE # VOTANa_vot_FEED #VOTANt1_FEED #VOTANt4_FEED #VOEVENT_SOURCE #sort&mark the not-used with "[]". END_SITE BEGIN_SITE # Site_administrative items: SITE_NAME SWIFT_OPS DATES 25juN05 25JuN05 SITE_LON_LAT -77.45 38.85 DIST_METHOD SOCKET DIST_ADDRESS capella2.gsfc.nasa.gov:5190 NO_CONNECT_NOTICE 1 DM_CS D C POC_NAME Scott_Barthelmy POC_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov DAILY_REPORT_ENABLE 1 DAILY_REPORT_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov CONFIG_REPORT 0 # Site-specific items: TRIGGER_ID 0 INTENSITY -1.000 ERROR 360.1000 DELAY 999.9 SIGNIFICANCE 0.00 CONF_LEVEL 0.00 OBSERVABILITY ALL SIMBAD_NED 0 # Type-specific items: COMMENT The socket connection that GCN_main receives the Swift messages from swift_tdrss_receiver. #COMMENT It is swift_tdrss_receiver (a GCN pre-processor program) that connects to the Swift "whitesands fanout box" computer. END_SITE BEGIN_SITE # Site_administrative items: SITE_NAME GLAST_OPS DATES 24sep05 24sep05 SITE_LON_LAT -77.45 38.85 DIST_METHOD SOCKET DIST_ADDRESS capella2.gsfc.nasa.gov:5240 NO_CONNECT_NOTICE 1 DM_CS D C POC_NAME Scott_Barthelmy POC_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov DAILY_REPORT_ENABLE 1 DAILY_REPORT_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov CONFIG_REPORT 0 # Site-specific items: TRIGGER_ID 0 INTENSITY -1.000 ERROR 360.1000 DELAY 999.9 SIGNIFICANCE 0.00 CONF_LEVEL 0.00 OBSERVABILITY ALL SIMBAD_NED 0 # Type-specific items: COMMENT The socket connection that GCN_main receives the Fermi messages from fermi_receiver. #COMMENT It is fermi_receiver (a GCN pre-processor program) that connects to the Fermi "whitestar" and "blackstar" computers. END_SITE BEGIN_SITE # Site_administrative items: SITE_NAME LVC_OPS DATES 12dec13 12dec13 SITE_LON_LAT -77.45 38.85 DIST_METHOD SOCKET DIST_ADDRESS capella2.gsfc.nasa.gov:5340 NO_CONNECT_NOTICE 0 DM_CS D C POC_NAME Scott_Barthelmy POC_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov DAILY_REPORT_ENABLE 1 DAILY_REPORT_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov CONFIG_REPORT 0 # Site-specific items: TRIGGER_ID 0 INTENSITY -1.000 ERROR 360.1000 DELAY 999.9 SIGNIFICANCE 0.00 CONF_LEVEL 0.00 OBSERVABILITY ALL SIMBAD_NED 0 # Type-specific items: COMMENT The socket connection that GCN_main receives the lvc messages from lvc_receiver. #COMMENT It is lvc_receiver (a GCN pre-processor program) that connects to the LIGO/LVC "emfollow" ("gracedb" and "curly") computers #COMMENT (and the TestIn lvc_sim program). END_SITE BEGIN_SITE # Site_administrative items: SITE_NAME LVC_BENTPIPE_FEED DATES 11nov18 11nov18 SITE_LON_LAT -77.45 38.85 DIST_METHOD SOCKET #DIST_ADDRESS capella2.gsfc.nasa.gov:5339 DIST_ADDRESS 128.183.96.236:5339 NO_CONNECT_NOTICE 0 DM_CS D C POC_NAME Scott_Barthelmy POC_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov DAILY_REPORT_ENABLE 1 DAILY_REPORT_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov CONFIG_REPORT 0 # Site-specific items: TRIGGER_ID 0 INTENSITY -1.000 ERROR 360.1000 DELAY 999.9 SIGNIFICANCE 0.00 CONF_LEVEL 0.00 OBSERVABILITY ADMIN SIMBAD_NED 0 # Type-specific items: #NOOP_MIS_INSTR # I do not know why this entry complains about no types specified. It is just like the regular voevent entries # in that they have explicitly listed notice types. (Ah, but I had to make them AMDIN as well. And they have "FEED" in the 'sitename'.) # And now (27nov18) does not seen to need even the NOOP_MIS_INSTR any more. COMMENT The "bent pipe" connection that GCN_main receives the LVC-as-sent format/content messages from lvc_receiver (which are a straight pass-thru from emfollow). #COMMENT It is lvc_receiver (a GCN pre-processor program) that connects to the LIGO/LVC "emfollow" ("gracedb" and "curly") computers #COMMENT (and the TestIn lvc_sim program). END_SITE BEGIN_SITE # Site_administrative items: SITE_NAME LVC_1440_FEED DATES 06jan21 06jan21 SITE_LON_LAT -77.45 38.85 DIST_METHOD SOCKET # Port 5338 is the real one. DIST_ADDRESS 128.183.96.236:5338 NO_CONNECT_NOTICE 0 DM_CS D C POC_NAME Scott_Barthelmy POC_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov DAILY_REPORT_ENABLE 1 DAILY_REPORT_ADDRESS sbarthel@milkyway.gsfc.nasa.gov CONFIG_REPORT 0 # Site-specific items: TRIGGER_ID 0 INTENSITY -1.000 ERROR 360.1000 DELAY 999.9 SIGNIFICANCE 0.00 CONF_LEVEL 0.00 OBSERVABILITY ADMIN SIMBAD_NED 0 # Type-specific items: #NOOP_MIS_INSTR # I DO NOT KNOW WHY THIS ENTRY COMPLAINS ABOUT NO TYPES SPECIFIED. IT IS JUST LIKE THE REGULAR VOEVENT ENTRIES # IN THAT THEY HAVE EXPLICITLY LISTED NOTICE TYPES. (Ah, but I had to make them ADMIN as well. And they have "FEED" in the 'sitename'.) COMMENT This is the "1440, ie the name of the new pkt size)" connection that GCN_main receives the LVC-as-sent format/content messages from lvc_receiver (which are a straight pass-thry from emfollow). COMMENT It is lvc_receiver (a GCN pre-processor program) that connects to the LIGO/LVC "emfollow" ("gracedb" and "curly") computers COMMENT (and the TestIn lvc_sim program).
